  9#ifndef VSIP_CORE_METAPROGRAMMING_HPP
 10#define VSIP_CORE_METAPROGRAMMING_HPP
 11
 12#include <vsip/core/c++0x.hpp>
 13#include <complex>
 14
 15/***********************************************************************
 16  Declarations
 17***********************************************************************/
 18
 19namespace vsip
 20{
 21
 22namespace impl
 23{
 24
 25/// If-Then-Else class.  Chooses either IfType::type or ElseType::type
 26/// based on boolean predicate.
 27
 28template <bool     Predicate,
 29	  typename IfType,
 30	  typename ElseType>
 31struct ITE_Type;
 32
 33template <typename IfType,
 34	  typename ElseType>
 35struct ITE_Type<true, IfType, ElseType>
 36{
 37  typedef typename IfType::type type;
 38};
 39
 40template <typename IfType,
 41	  typename ElseType>
 42struct ITE_Type<false, IfType, ElseType>
 43{
 44  typedef typename ElseType::type type;
 45};
 46
 47
 48
 49/// Wrap a type so that it can be accessed via ::type.
 50
 51template <typename T>
 52struct As_type
 53{
 54  typedef T type;
 55};
 56
 57
 58
 59/// Compare two types for "equality".
 60
 61template <typename T1,
 62	  typename T2>
 63struct Type_equal
 64{
 65  static bool const value = false;
 66};
 67
 68template <typename T>
 69struct Type_equal<T, T>
 70{
 71  static bool const value = true;
 72  typedef T type;
 73};
 74
 75
 76
 77/// Pass type through if boolean value is true.  Used for SFINAE.
 78
 79template <typename T,
 80	  bool     Bool>
 81struct Type_if;
 82
 83template <typename T>
 84struct Type_if<T, true>
 85{
 86  typedef T type;
 87};
 88
 89
 90
 91/// Compare a compile-time value against a run-time value.
 92
 93/// Useful for avoiding '-W -Wall' warnings when comparing a compile-time
 94/// template parameters with a run-time variable.
 95
 96template <typename T, T X>
 97struct Compare
 98{
 99  bool operator>(T t) { return X > t; }
100};
101
102
103/// Speclialization for T == unsigned and X == 0.  This avoids a GCC
104/// '-W -Wall' warning that comparison against compile-time 0 is
105/// always true.
106
107template <>
108struct Compare<unsigned, 0>
109{
110  bool operator>(unsigned /*t*/) { return false; }
111};
112
113template <typename T> struct Scalar_of 
114  { typedef T type; };
115template <typename T> struct Scalar_of<std::complex<T> >
116  { typedef typename Scalar_of<T>::type type; };
117
118template <typename T>
119struct Complex_of 
120{ typedef std::complex<T> type; };
121
122template <typename T>
123struct Complex_of<std::complex<T> >
124{ typedef std::complex<T> type; };
125
126template <typename T>
127struct Is_complex
128{ static bool const value = false; };
129
130template <typename T>
131struct Is_complex<std::complex<T> >
132{ static bool const value = true; };
133
134
135template <bool Value>
136struct Bool_type
137{ static const bool value = Value; };
138
139template <int Value>
140struct Int_type
141{ static const int value = Value; };
142
143struct false_type { static const bool value = false; };
144struct true_type  { static const bool value = true; };
145
146
147// Strip const qualifier from type.
148
149template <typename T>
150struct Non_const_of
151{ typedef T type; };
152
153template <typename T>
154struct Non_const_of<T const>
155{ typedef T type; };
156
157
158
159// Compare two pointers for equality
160
161template <typename Ptr1,
162	  typename Ptr2>
163struct Is_same_ptr
164{
165  static bool compare(Ptr1, Ptr2) { return false; }
166};
167
168template <typename PtrT>
169struct Is_same_ptr<PtrT, PtrT>
170{
171  static bool compare(PtrT ptr1, PtrT ptr2) { return ptr1 == ptr2; }
172};
173
174template <typename Ptr1,
175	  typename Ptr2>
176inline bool
177is_same_ptr(
178  Ptr1* ptr1,
179  Ptr2* ptr2)
180{
181  return Is_same_ptr<Ptr1*, Ptr2*>::compare(ptr1, ptr2);
182}
183
184template <typename Ptr1,
185	  typename Ptr2>
186inline bool
187is_same_ptr(
188  std::pair<Ptr1*, Ptr1*> const& ptr1,
189  std::pair<Ptr2*, Ptr2*> const& ptr2)
190{
191  return Is_same_ptr<Ptr1*, Ptr2*>::compare(ptr1.first, ptr2.first) &&
192         Is_same_ptr<Ptr1*, Ptr2*>::compare(ptr1.second, ptr2.second);
193}
194
195} // namespace impl
196} // namespace vsip
197
198#endif // VSIP_CORE_METAPROGRAMMING_HPP
